body.description: After the death of his young daughter, commercial artist Jim Burton (Richard Egan) sank into a destructive struggle with the bottle that those around him-from his patient wife (Julie London) to his concerned doctor (Walter Matthau)-were unable to pull him out of. As he bottoms out, will his fateful encounter with a fellow alcoholic (Arthur O'Connell) spur him to find a path toward sobriety, for others as well as himself? Noirish social drama also stars Troy Donahue, Mae Clarke, Ann Doran. 103 min. Widescreen; Soundtrack: English. Region Free

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 24, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Entertaining melodrama about a hopeless drunk seeking salvation
reviews.reviewText: Made and set in the late fifties, this gripping melodrama is a realistic portrayal of a middle class commercial artist, Jim, fallen prey to chronic alcoholism, his long suffering wife, and a mysterious stranger he meets in a drunk tank who tells him there is a way to stay sober. The hero, portrayed by Richard Egan rebels against everyone trying to help him, including his wife (Julie London) and doctor (Walter Matthau). In a moment of desperation he starts taking the stranger's advice and tries to help fellow drunks. Of course, nothing is less reliable than a drunk and Jim fears everything will fall apart. Also starring Arthur O'Connell and Troy Donahue. Score by Henry Mancini.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 15, 2022
reviews.reviewText: I had seen this movie over 45 years ago and it really stayed with me. At that time I had a bad drinking problem and I really related to it. It is worth watching for all.
